object.property:
This is basically a no-op at this time. It just allows assigning a name and in the future will be used to control the look of the Tree display.
Usage: test:testName value:TEST_NAME

causes the browser to attempt to open the url found in the value field
usage: test:openSite value:url

find is used to find a value from root based on the criteria selected from one of the active criteria radio buttons. Fails if the value is not found.
usage: type:find criteria:(a criteria radio button) value:some_string example: find id content

findNot is used to find a value from root based on the criteria selected from one of the active criteria radio buttons. Fails if the value IS found. It can be used to confirm that a value is not on the page.
usage: type:findNot criteria:(a criteria radio button) value:some_string example: findNot id content

findSub is used to find a value from below the previous tag based on the criteria selected from one of the active criteria radio buttons. It allows sectioning out a web page based on the previous find or findSub. This helps reduce the possibility of finding the same value in the wrong location. Fails if the value is not found.
usage: type:findSub criteria:(a criteria radio button) value:some_string example: findSub id content

findSubNot is used to confirm that the value below the previous tag and criteria does not exist. It allows sectioning out a web page based on the previous find or findSub. This helps reduce the possibility of finding the same value in the wrong location. Fails if the value IS found.
usage: type:findSubNot criteria:(a criteria radio button) value:some_string example: findSubNot id content

Used to confirm that a criteria and value are as expected. Fails if not.
usage: type:assert criteria:criteria [value:value] example assert is_diaplayed will fail if the current tag is not displayed. It is commonly used for pop-up menus.

Used to confirm that a criteria and value are not present in the current tag. If they are, then it fails.
usage: type:assertNot criteria:criteria [value:value] example assertNot is_diaplayed will fail if the current tag IS displayed. It is commonly used for pop-up menus.
Not implemented yet. It will be used to assert that the value in a particular field is equal to a variable.
Not implemented yet. It will be used to assert that the value in a particular field is not equal to a variable.
Cause the browser to click on the current element. It takes no arguments.

Cause execution to wait the number of seconds specified in the value field. It is sometimes necessary to give the browser a chance to load especially after clicking a link to a new locations.
example: wait 1.5 causes execution to pause for 1.5 seconds.

causes the browser to go back to the previous page. It clicks the back button.
It take no arguments.
Causes the browser to refresh on the current page. It takes no arguments.
Causes the browser to go to the url specified in the value field. It is the same as openSite and I thinking about removing it.

Causes TestRunner to note that a subroutine begins on the next step so it can be called later. All steps in the subroutine are passed over up to, and including the return statement. When a subroutine is called with a gosub type, then execution starts on the step immediately after the subroutine step.

causes execution to begin immediately after the subroutine named in the value field
usage: type:subroutine value:"name of subroutine"
If the named subroutine does not exist, it will fail
causes execution to return to the step immediately after the step that called it. Be careful not to put a gosub call in the last step.

Allows adding comments into the script to help in readability. The actual comment goes in the value field.
usage: type:COMMENT value:(some text)

Allows sending a string to the browser. Useful for filling in text fields.
usage: type:sendKeys value:(some string)
Not yet implemented, but will be used to get a value into a variable.
Not yet implemented, but will be used to add a value to the current variable. If the value does not exist or is not an integer it will fail
Used by find, findNot, findSub, and findSubNot to find HTML tag id with the value given in the "value" field.
Used by find, findNot, findSub, and findSubNot to find HTML tag with the value given in the "value" field.
Used by find, findNot, findSub, and findSubNot to find HTML tag classwith the value given in the "value" field.
Used by find, findNot, findSub, and findSubNot to find HTML whose link text contains the link text with the value given in the "value" field.

Used by find, findNot, findSub, and findSubNot to look at (a) tags which to see if they contain the text provided in value.
It's also used by assert and assertNot to compare the text in the current element to the text provided in "value"
Used by assert and assertNot to determine whether the text in the current element that is associated with the src attribute is equal to the value in "value"
used by assert and assertNot to determine whether the current element is displayed.
used by find, findNot, findSub, and findSubNot to find an element whose image attribute is equal to the value in the "value" field.
View details of currently selected step
Insert a new step before the currently selected step
Add a new step after the currently selected step
Execute the step that is currently selected
